newsitem.title: GERMANY: Paribas says keeps SKW Trostberg on buy.
newsitem.headline: Paribas says keeps SKW Trostberg on buy.

text.p: Paribas Capital Markets said on Friday it was maintaining its buy recommendation for German speciality chemicals group SKW Trostberg AG and had not changed its earnings forecasts.
Paribas analyst Markus Reichle said he still expected SKW's earnings per share to be 2.35 marks for 1996 and 3.50 marks for 1997.
"We regard the share as a clear buy," Reichle said.
SKW would become a global player in the construction chemicals business next year following the completion of its purchase of Master Builders Technologies (MBT) from Swiss group Sandoz AG.
In addition SKW earnings would benefit from a cost savings programme in its natural products division, Reichle said.

Earlier in the day SKW said its operating profits in the first nine months of 1996 were about unchanged from the year-ago period while sales rose four percent to 2.97 billion marks despite the sale of non-core activities.
The comany will release more detailed results at a news conference on November 20.
BHF Bank earlier in the day cut its recommendation to hold from buy and reduced its earnings forecasts, helping send the share price lower.
